did.unittitle: Charles H. Hall letter of invitation from the American Colonization Society
did.abstract: Letter requesting Charles H. Hall to speak at the 70th meeting of the American Colonization Society in Washington, D.C. Dated 1886. The Reverend Charles Henry Hall (1820-1895) was rector of the Holy Trinity Church, located at Clinton and Montague Streets in Brooklyn, N.Y., from January 1869 until his death.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The American Colonization Society was established in 1817 and was originally named the American Society for Colonizing the Free People of Colour of the United States. The Society supported the idea of helping free African Americans settle in Africa so as to enjoy greater freedoms.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Reverend Charles Henry Hall (1820-1895) was rector of the Holy Trinity Church, located at Clinton and Montague Streets in Brooklyn, N.Y., from January 1869 until his death. On January 11, 1887, he led the funeral service of his friend and prominent Brooklyn clergyman Henry Ward Beecher.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter requesting Charles H. Hall to speak at the 70th meeting of the American Colonization Society in Washington, D.C. Dated 1886.
